39305497.review:
Изначально я был не уверен в покупке Tokyo Xanadu, т.к. не играл в другие игры данного разработчика, но сеттинг меня заинтересовал. Подавив свою жадность и купив игру, я был приятно удивлен.

[h1]Плюсы[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Сюжет[/b] довольно банален (хотя некоторые интересные повороты там есть), но подача очень хороша, за ним просто приятно следить. Отдельно хочется выделить персонажей, даже у большинства побочных есть свои мини-истории, которые развиваются на протяжении основного сюжета. 
    [*][b]Геймплей[/b]. Сюжет поделен на главы, а каждая глава на несколько дней. Один из дней выделяется для «свободного времени», когда игрок может свободно перемещаться по локациям города, разговаривать с персами, выполнять побочные квесты, проходить побочные данжи (или перепроходить ранее пройденные, чтоб улучшить результат или просто пофармить). Остальные дни посвящены сюжету данной главы.
    [*][b]Боевка[/b]. Изначально она мне казалась ооочень примитивной и однообразной. На деле же все оказалось очень хорошо, и я не совсем понимаю, почему именно. Возможно, из-за довольно быстрого темпа прохождения подземелий в надежде получить S-результат с первого раза. Возможно, из-за довольно разного геймплея за каждого персонажа. У кого-то есть удобные дальнобойные атаки, кто-то умеет создавать барьеры, кто-то просто универсален и более-менее хорош во всем, а кто-то очень медленный и почти бесполезный [strike](да, да, Шио, это я про тебя)[/strike]. На каждый данж нужно выбрать 3 персонажей, каждый силен против определенной стихии, и на протяжении дажна необходимо переключать персов, чтоб получить преимущество против определенных врагов.
    [*][b]Музыка[/b]. Боевая музыка довольно простенькая, но динамичная и приятная. Вне боев хорошо подчеркивает атмосферу.
[/list]
[h1]Минусы[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Однообразные данжи и типы врагов[/b]. 
    [*][b]Довольно слабые возможности прокачки[/b]. Игрок может менять только одежду, ботинки, 2 аксессуара, а также вставлять камни в слоты (4-6 штук в зависимости у персонажа), которые увеличивают статы или дают доп. возможности (типа шанса заморозки врагов, шанса поджога врагов и т.д.).
    [*][b]Странности со сложностью[/b]. На максимальной сложности первые боссы слишком сложные. Проблемы не с уроном, ваншоты меня устраивают, а в жирности боссов, их слишком долго нужно убивать, а одна ошибка – все заново. Но довольно быстро становится проще (мб даже слишком просто), и играется уже комфортно.
[/list]
Tokyo Xanadu, к моему удивлению, оказалась прям очень хороша. В ней есть недостатки, но они не особо мешают наслаждаться игрой. Жаль, что история завершилась, я буду скучать по персонажам [strike](нет, Шио, тебя это не касается)[/strike] и надеяться на продолжение.

39294031.review:
Tokyo Xanadu is an interesting fusion of ideas from different Falcom games, and this mix (while imperfect) works very well.  Its core structure is reminiscent of Trails of Cold Steel, and combat falls somewhere between Ys VII and VIII (closer to VIII) in style.  Its dungeons are quite varied in layout and design, although few are long enough to take more than 20 minutes to complete -- an intentional decision to encourage brisk speedruns and portability.

Story wise, while the plot is generally more predictable than most other Falcom games outside of a handful of well-done twists, characterization is excellent and the cast is extremely likable.  Minor characters and NPCs are given the same sort of plot lines as can be seen in Trails/Kiseki, and many of these can be quite endearing as they develop over the course of the game.

The music is, of course, fantastic.  It's exactly what you'd expect from Falcom Sound Team, with a number of really outstanding dungeon tracks that will get you pumped for another go.  If you enjoy Falcom music, you'll have nothing to complain about on this front.

The port itself is quite good, and there are few technical issues to write home about.  There is a 60fps cap, but frame pacing is excellent and it is a very rock solid 60; most people on modern systems should never see frame drops.  It is also quite stable; I've only had one crash in close to 90 hours playing it.

Full Disclosure: I was a beta tester for this game and as such received a free copy for testing.  I'd still have bought it otherwise though, because it's a fantastic action RPG that shouldn't be missed, even if it is overshadowed by Falcom's tentpole series.

39130482.review:
Take the social and adventure bits of Trails of Cold Steel, and replace the Field and dungeon bits with the action parts of Zwei 2/Ys and you end up with Tokyo Xanadu Ex+. 

This is not going to surprise fans of the genre or of Falcom. Music is good. The assets are mid-tier so graphics and effects are not going to wow you. The story is mostly fine and have enough twists and turns to be entertaining even if you can see what's coming. As usual with Falcom, it is the whole that is more than the sum of its parts. 

Note to those who don't like reading. Lots of reading plus it is original Japanese speech with subtitles. No dub. 

The good: 
[list]
[*]A decently long adventure. I think the original release would had been lacking but the eX+ additions add a lot. 
[*]The episode format breaks things up into nice chunks so it doesn't drag too much, other than a couple of chapters that are a bit long in the middle. 
[*]Simple action that seems a bit too basic at first but actually flows well. 
[*]The well-fleshed out characters and NPCs you expect from Falcom (whether you like them or not is a matter of taste). 
[*]Some really nice voice-work for several of the characters! 
[*]Solid PC port. Nothing remarkable but was stable and ran well for my entire game. 
[*]Falcom music goodness! 
[*]More Towa! Maybe this is fan-service but she was a fun character nevertheless. 
[/list]

The kinda alright:
[list]
[*]A very middling localisation/translation. The first half was mostly fine but it may be Aksys didn't give it enough resources and ran out of time. The dialogue and translation becomes increasingly bad after the mid-point, with some parts "all over the place". Overall, I can only call it 'adequate', which is a shame because the start was pretty OK. 
[*]Some chapters drag a bit, especially if you want to run around to talk to everyone to avoid missing anything. 
[*]A couple of sudden difficulty spikes. Overall (on Normal) I had no trouble but the hard parts were a bit of a sudden shock. 
[*]Torn about how to judge this but for some parts, there is no text box and with the speech still in Japanese, it means unless you understand that a bit you won't know what they are saying. 
[/list]

The bad: 
[list]
[*]I am not too particular about translations (whether you keep honourifics or not, or literal or not) but the number of *chortle* and *giggle* just got a bit much. Again, the start didn't seem quite as bad but and yes, I am sure that's how it is in the original Japanese but it was too much towards the end. 
[*]The camera hates you, especially in some of the later dungeons. It becomes pot-luck if the camera will decide to mess around and you end up fight it, the controls, and the monsters at the same time. 
[/list]

39010557.review:
I'm a long-time Falcom fan and have been playing and loving their games since the SNES days.  As such, it pains me to say that I honestly don't like Tokyo Xanadu very much.  I've tried to give it a fair chance and have pushed myself to play it, but I'm just not enjoying it.

People have sometimes called it a "combination of Ys and Trails of Cold Steel," and that's true, except it combined the worst parts of both.  The plot moves at a glacier's pace; every chapter follows the same formula of one of your friends getting into trouble, getting sucked into a portal into another dimension, you have to go rescue them, and then their personal problems are fixed.  Each chapter is bookended by a few mysterious characters doing mysterious things that you're supposed to be intrigued by, but the answers to the mysteries are not nearly as interesting as they lead you to believe.  The out-of-combat gameplay is very Trails-like, in that there are countless NPCs you're expected to talk to between every scene, except rather than being set in an interesting fantasy world, TX is set in modern Japan; if you've ever watched an anime series featuring high school students, you'll automatically recognize all of the tropes.  There's nothing new here.  Occasionally something interesting will happen at the end of a chapter, but then it's right back to the mundane.

The gameplay is decent, but not up to the level of any Ys game.  Movement and action are relatively slow; there are many characters you can play as, but each character has a very limited move set, and most of the characters' move sets are very similar to each other.  There's a wide variety of accessories you can equip to increase characters' stats and upgrade their abilities, but none of them offer any fundamental changes to the gameplay.  Palette-swapped enemies fill every dungeon, and after a while you'll even start running into palette-swapped bosses, which would have been inexcusable for an Ys game.  The Ys games are great because they're short and sweet and constantly throwing new things at you, but TX felt the need to pad out its gameplay enough to match the padded-out story, and it didn't go well.  In chapter 6, near the end of the game, I went through two entire dungeons in order so that I could fix an alarm clock and a broken TV.  They were both filled with enemies I had killed a dozen hours before.  Yawn.  I could have done a speed run of Ys: The Oath in Felghana in that time.

If you've played every other Falcom game on Steam and are jonesing for more, TX might give you what you want, if you can handle pushing through the boring parts.  There are almost certainly better options out there.

38999309.review:
Tokyo Xanadu is a game that not many will probably come to purchase simply because it doesn't seem like the sort of game that's worth the price for what it presents in trailers and screenshots. But after completing the game (and all the extra content) in its entirety I can honestly say it's definitely worth the price tag for the amount of content you get. 

Playing through the story is sort of like watching an anime set in the modern era with fantasy elements--- one that you would normally rate a 7/10 in your book. Solid, but hardly innovative in the genre. However the same story presented and executed well in video game format warrants this particular one a 9/10 in my book. Again, whilst it does nothing innovative in the genre in terms of storytelling, it does execute it in such a way that makes the story worth more than it is on paper.

Many reviews have compared this to the Persona series and the Ys, and while I can't attest to it being similar to the latter (due to not having played any of the Ys games), it does have the makings of a Persona game in terms of how characters interact with one another, as well as the tropes used in said interactions. 

Combat is simple yet fulfilling when you play the game 'right'. With the player skill cap mostly coming from how you deal with the bosses and less about each character's (similar yet slightly different) mechanics. Grinding can get tiring as most of the dungeon monsters can be regarded as 'fillers' but I find the story was enough to keep me going-- and me being me, I didn't want to be 'weak' when it came down to fighting the bosses. 

As someone who is interested in the world-building aspects of video games in general, I do hope that the developers continue this "Xanadu" world which they've built-- as the game leaves a lot of room for more stories to be told. Hopefully more people pay attention to this game and with luck, we'll get to see Nihon Falcom deliver more of it for us in the future-- perhaps with different characters in other parts of the Xanadu world.

All in all a well rounded package if you like an ARPG with a Persona style characters and tropes. 9/10.

38865799.review:
Краткое описание игры будет таким: Trails of Cold Steel с боевой системой из Ys. Если играли в версию на Вите, то в этой добавлены сцены и дополнительная глава после истинной концовки.

Из ToCS здесь мини-игры (да, один-в-один) и подача сюжета: игра разделена на главы, в каждой главе вы проживаете несколько дней из жизни школьников - в этот раз "обычных японских", а не фэнтезийных. В течение дней вы можете собирать разные коллекции, следить за НПС (да, КАЖДЫЙ непись имеет свою историю, которая будет развиваться с ходом дней с начала и до самого конца игры). В один из дней в каждой главе вам дадут "свободное время", которое можно тратить на сайд-квесты, дополнительные данжи и свидания с друзьями - сценки, раскрывающие их истории и улучшающие ваши отношения. Увидеть все можно лишь за два прохождения, но лучшие концовки получаются и за одно. Оружие в игре модифицируется с помощью камней с особыми свойствами, которые вы будете собирать везде, где попадется. В зависимости от камней персонаж может получить мощные баффы или бонусы к статам. Разные комбинации подойдут к разным стилям игры.

Собственно все персонажи, которых вы получите в пати, имеют свои уникальные черты с самого начала: кто-то медленный, но сильный, кто-то стреляет на бегу, а у кого-то есть волшебный барьер неуязвимости. Все это очень сильно сказывается в бою, так как здесь он активный, а не пошаговый. Вы в реальном времени бегаете по арене, уворачиваетесь, прыгаете и используете навыки, чтобы сразить врагов, имея возможность на ходу переключаться между тремя персонажами, участвующими в исследовании данжа. Отдельно можно упомянуть боссов, которые боссы, а не просто толстые мобы. Они легче вариантов из Ys, но все равно заставляют просчитывать свои атаки.

В общем же, немного перебор с копированием ToCS в игре, но если Trails вам нравилась или вы не играли, то сыграть в TX стоит... и в отличие от ToCS сюжет здесь завершен, а не "подождите еще четыре года до следующей игры".

It is Y's like due to the gameplay of the battles. The battles are an ARPG style similar to Y's 7 or 8. Each of your characters have an element that they use and some enemies in the dungeon are weak to that element. You can switch between three different party members while you are in the dungeon. That means you can customize your party for each dungeon and switch as you come across different enemies. 

Con's

The dungeons are kinda stale in style. Rather linear for the most part from what I've seen.

38700063.review:
Tokyo Xanadu eX+ is a proper Action RPG from Nihon Falcom and is a welcome addition to the PC roster of JRPGs. So far, this is perhaps the only JRPG with a modern urban fantasy setting in the PC market and that makes it unique to some extent [b](If anyone has any reccomendations for more such urban fantasy JRPGs for the PC, feel free to leave suggestions. I love the genre and would love to play more)[/b].

First off, yes, the game borrows heavily from Persona in terms of some settings but the similarities end about halfway into the first chapter. The biggest change being that the protagonist here has a well-defined personality and is not a blank slate unlike in the Persona games. Other obvious differences include the action combat, the way the bonding events take place and of course, the packaging of the game. The game also goes the extra mile of fleshing out the NPCs, on whom you can collect trivia which will flesh out their characters throughout the entire length of the game.

The packaging is the best part of this game, as every chapter is its own self-contained story arc which has one of the playbable characters as the focus but also advances the overarching plot. Every chapter has its prologue and an epilogue which is followed up immediately by an interlude like Side Story. These Side Stories are short episodes featuring the characters other than the main playable character which give a definitive end to their individual story arcs. These also set up the [spoiler]After Story Plot[/spoiler] as well as flesh out the characters as individuals. However, the main plot develops these same characters as a collective. Every chapter also has an opening theme, making the chapters feel like episodes of an anime (which was a major appeal to me, I admit) and is a signature of other Falcom games as well.

The plot and setting are quite intriguing, placing the players in a world fraught with mystery and intrigue filled with esoteric organizations springing around an unexplained phenomenon called "The Eclipse". The main characters decide to unravel the mystery after they are inadvertently drawn into a series of incidents which may have connections to an event [spoiler](Tokyo Earthquake/Tokyo Twilight Disaster)[/spoiler] that happened 10 years ago in the game's timeline. The lore is rich and the enemy designs are pretty good.

The game is fairly long and like me, if you take time playing the various mini-games (there are a LOT and some even have great prizes like master cores and helpful elements) and farming materials for upgrades and equipment, it will take quite a bit of time. The eX+ in the title isn't just for show either as the game has a very pronounced post-game content along with a new game+ mode that has extra dungeons not found in the first playthrough. The music and the three songs featured in the game are good.

Finally, the localization might be spotty at places but it is still enjoyable and some of the translations have quite the comedic value (both intentional and unintentional, Aksys employees love the Cthulhu mythos and World of Darkness). Other miscellaneous additions include the boss rush mode where you can replay the boss battles in the game. The Gallery and Character Viewer are also fun additions.

Overall, for the asking price Tokyo Xanadu eX+ is engaging and enjoyable. This is the true definitive edition of Tokyo Xanadu and comes with all associated bells and whistles so the DLCs (which are atrociously priced) can be igonred without issue. That's about it, I guess. Hopefully, we get a sequel for this sometime soon.

38679691.review:
Tokyo Xanadu eX+ is a Action RPG by Nihon Falcom, best known for the Legend of Heroes series and the Ys Series, that is certainly not their best work and has its fair share of flaws however in the it it still manages to be a good game that is fun to play.

The gameplay can be described as Ys with (I have not played Ys 8 yet so this based on the old series that are on Steam) extra resources to spend in battle along with the inventory system of Legend of Heroes.
This does cause that the game can feel quite easy at times, I was playing on hard, since the only limit on items is the 99 cap and a cooldown on certain difficulties.

It also has an orbment system alike to the Legend of Heroes series, mostly to the Cold Steel entries although with the names altered. Also has cooking and several mini-games inside the game. The Dungeons are very basic most of them are just simple "go down this corridor, kill some mobs and then get to the boss" with sometimes "oh yeah press these buttons on the way" so there isn't much to write about this. What is fun is how the game plays and the feeling of going fast and killing a lot of enemies.

Story wise, The story is not bad but it does suffer from an abundance of generic anime cliches that make the story quite predictable in places, the characters are the strong point of the narrative though that is a pattern with some of Falcom's games. But at least in my opinion it does things worse than those games. Also might get a bit formulaic at times.

However, and while this is a Falcom standard, what I really do appreciate is the huge amount of NPC flavor text and whilst the quests that the game has are quite few compared to other RPG's with open world elements, the quests that are there are interesting since they often times offer a mini-story that affects things in the world and even has effects for longer then just right after doing the quest.

Graphically it is pretty standard, nothing to write home about I personally enjoy this style and I wouldn't mind if the graphical levels didn't change. The options for this game are rather lackluster compared to other Falcom games but this is a port by a company that doesn't really do PC ports that often and whilst barebones it does run solid at 1080p60fps on my machine.

The soundtrack is pretty good but that is to be expected from Falcom since they just have a way with soundtracks.
Aksys Games translated this game and whilst I did notice some irregularities(and I generally don't pay attention to those) on the surface level it seems like they translated it just fine(though serious from "this is our final stage lets do this or something" to "this is it" is a bit.... lackluster I suppose?).

- Should you buy this game?
The amount of content that this game has to offer is good for current price point but that only applies if you like it.
Right now I'd say it is a hard sell if you aren't a fan of Nihon Falcom or if you haven't played most of the flagship titles by Falcom that are on Steam(Trails in the Sky, Cold Steel and Ys series).
However if you are a fan of the games they have made, then I'd say the game currently is worth it at the price. Even more if you buy via humble bundle if you have a monthly subscription.
Otherwise, I'd say buy the flagship titles of Nihon before this one because they excel at certain points where this game is good to great at those points.

If the legend of heroes/ys was an 9/10 then this game is a 7,5 due to some issues in areas that make it inferior to either of them but whilst providing both of them. It is a very solid Action RPG Game that I had a blast whilst playing it.

38521616.review:
Trails of Cold Steel + Persona + Zwei!!

Got your attention ?

Tokyo Xanadu is fantastic. I waited almost 2 years for it to get localized and it did not disappoint me in the slightest. The PC port is really well optimized. I'm sure low end PCs will have no problem running it although there is a lack of graphical settings I'd still say It's a great port. My favorite part is the gameplay. The combat system is kinda similar to zwei!! at first but later as you unlock more characters it becomes unique. with that said, the combat is amazing. I had a lot of fun with it. The bonding system is the same as Trails of Cold Steel. You can spend time with characters every chapter by watching their bonding episodes and improve your bond with them. It's the same as ToCS really. The game is similar to persona in regard that you spend 70% of the game talking, watching cutscenes, doing side-quests in the city or playing a mini-game and 30% in combat or dungeon exploration. There is a lot of talking in this game even by falcom's standards. so be prepared for that.

The story is somewhat predictable. Not saying it's bad It's just that it lacks any plot twist until the final chapter. It has great character development. Even the characters you may not like at first start to grow on you as you play the story. Like every falcom game, the NPCs are amazing. You can really connect with them nicely if you talk to them every chapter. The same opening plays after every chapter which kinda gives a feeling that you're playing a shounen anime. It's really nice. It also has a really satisfying and heartwarming ending. Overall while the story is not anything mind blowing, It's still really nice for an RPG.

Like every falcom game the soundtrack is great. No complaints there. For an RPG this game has a decent amount of content. In 80+ hours I completed main story + Epilogue + After story, did every side-quest, Talked to every NPC every chapter and completed most mini-games.

Final Score: 9/10 If you wanna scratch that Falcom itch or just wanna play a good dialogue heavy action RPG. Get this game It's awesome.

38452499.review:
Tokyo Xanadu eX+ [東京ザナドeX+] is overall from what I've experienced, a pretty fun game. 
However, I've got a few things to note of what I like and dislike about the game so far.

[h1] Combat [/h1]
[b] The Good [/b]
[list]
[*] Very fluid once you get used to the controls 
[*] Fast-paced and fun
[*] A well thought out combat system with attention to balance especially
[/list]

[b] The Bad [/b]
[list]
[*] A lot of the regular enemies feel like just buffer to fill up space
[*] Bosses spam attacks like no tomorrow, I'll spend around a minute dodging just to land one attack
[*] This applies to more than combat, but the help menus still show the console controls, and sometimes don't even show the proper PC equivalent [Like Page down and Page up for your super]
[/list]

[h1] The Game as a Whole [/h1]
There's really just a few things to note here, as combat was the main thing I wanted to comment on.
[list]
[*] Change your keyboard controls this instant if you aren't using a controller. I mean it. They're just awful, I suggest the following changes: Camp menu → Esc, Jump → Space, Page up → Mouse5, Page down → Mouse4
[*] The graphics are quite dated, yes, however, you get pretty used to them after a bit and they don't take away from the experience that Falcom was trying to deliver
[*] Make sure you go into the DLC tab of items and unlock all of your free stuff, there are some cool outfits and materials, y'know?
[*] Don't be afraid of the game running poorly since it's a port. It runs flawlessly, even though I have completely overkill specs [1070, i5-6600k], I'm sure it will run well on older/weaker systems since the game appears to be well optimized
[*] The game does well in the large level of detail, which I feel makes up for the graphics. Make sure to check EVERYTHING out to get the full experience!
[/list]

[h1] My Final Thoughts [/h1]
At the current moment, I think $59.99 is a bit steep, I'd personally advise you to wait for the price to drop to at least $45 before you go to buy it. $30 would be ideal in my opinion.
[b] However, [/b] if you have the money for it and you like JRPGs, you played Persona and you liked it, then you probably won't regret nabbing this game for the full price. I don't regret the purchase, since it still is a pretty good game.

[u]Final Score:[/u] [b]8/10[/b]

Of course, I hope you all realize that these were just my thoghts from playing around 10 hours of the game, your experience and interpretation of the game can and probably will be vastly different, so take my review with a grain of salt. Value your own opinion more, y'know?
[b]I will update this review once I finish the game to clean this review up and put additional notes/score revision[/b]

38339503.review:
Another Falcom game comes to PC, this time courtesy of Aksys & Ghostlight. 
 
Your first thought when seeing the game is very likely "This looks like Persona 5".  A common one, but shallow, as the commonalities start disappearing well into the first act.  Progression is closer to the way Cold Steel does it, and combat is completely different, more akin to Ys. Also has decent, rebindable controls for both controller & kb/m , although I can't comment much on kb/m.
Music-wise, this game obviously delivers, with Falcom's JDK team continuing to make rock-solid music pieces that generally fit the tone and enhance an already great game.

Localization-wise,  the game is sub-only. The translation is still a bit spotty, but should be far ahead of the VITA version, at the very least.
Port-wise, it mostly delivers on the basics. 1080p60 with reports of the game doing 4k with not too much trouble. If you're expecting a "Cold Steel" quality port with Durante magic in it, you will come out disappointed, as aside from resolution, it's a match-4-match with the PS4 version.


Although the game is a tad bit pricey, I still think the asking price is worth it, if you have the money,at least. This only applies to the main game, the DLC is preposterously pricey and I confess I'm rather surprised Aksys went with that value, specially for the basic cheat ones.

The story is simple and effective, there's no useless dialogues (unless you want to talk to every npc), pretty fast, it's really easy to follow and very enjoyable. You'll get into it in no time. Plus it's like watching an anime, that's really the sensation that I got while playing this game.

Free time is a lot like the free time you got in the Persona series, you have a "bonding time" with other characters, you get to know your friends better that's really interesting. But this isn't Persona, you won't get an insane amount of free time. Actually you're just playing few days.

The combat is fast paced, each characters has their own style (slow attacks but hits like a truck or fast light damages for exemple). You don't need to grind in this game, that's something I like. Overall the combat system is pretty fun. Bosses can be tricky/challenging if you're on a high difficulty but you have your best weapon : The roll. I would really love to have more games like this one.

38304673.review:
[Played on PS4 for a few hours before getting it on Steam.]

I'm shockingly impressed with this game. I'm enjoying the story and characters, I adore the music, and the action-RPG gameplay is great.

It absolutely is Persona-inspired in terms of setup. In fact, some of the camera angles in the school building are so close to Yasogami High School from Persona 4 that I'm surprised more people haven't noticed.

However, it doesn't feel like a rip-off as a game. Nihon Falcom took Persona's world building and fused it into their own style of story telling and gameplay, and I really like the result.  

I'm a huge fan of the Persona series but its turn-based combat is definitely not my favorite part about it. 
While I'm not going to try to claim that Tokyo Xanadu's story so is better than Persona 3, 4, & 5 (Atlus are probably the best at what they do) but it's good enough that I'm actively enjoying it rather than simply tolerating it. The fact that I enjoy the combat as well means at no point am I just waiting to get through one aspect of the game to hurry on to the next.

I discovered this game by chance. I've seen almost no marketing for it so I'm worried it won't reach all of its potential audience in the West. It seems to have sold "ok" in Japan, so I really hope Nihon Falcom and Aksys Games both exceed or at least meet their sales expectations. 

I really want Tokyo Xanadu to continue. It doesn't need to be the same characters or continuity (in fact I hear the ending of this one is pretty definitive), but Nihon Falcom is off to a great start with this new IP and I want to see the results of them taking time to refine what they've created here.

(Also, I'm fine with them continuing to make it for handheld. If that means the series will continue to be graphically minimalist, I'm good. A great art style/aesthetic and sharpness is more imporant than realistic graphics anyway. 
In fact, Nihon Falcom - it seems like this would be a great game to port over to the Switch as well.)

38276386.review:
This game is both good and bad at the same time.

It can be frustrating when your knocked down by the monsters (especially bosses) and they queue up attack on you so you get up and are instantly hit with a high damage attack which follows on into a combo.

It can be really fun switching between Front, Back, and Support roles. This means the controls are fluid and are easy to use once you learn all of them.

I don't think this game actually has a menu in game except when your on free roam so when your viewing the events prior to free roam you most likely cannot save or quit without ALT + TAB.

The story isn't all that exciting with these baseline characters who are really just variations on a theme.

The graphics are a bit dated and it can detract from gameplay / immersion if your anal about that sort of stuff.

The combat mechanics and combat elements are well structured to allow most team comps to fight most enemies. One should note however there are lots of "St" weak monsters early in the game before you can use "St" attribute, possibly poor planning on the developer part but I'm not one to tell the devs how to create their game.

5/10 could do with some tidying up around the graphics and some nicer / more distinct characters.

38269608.review:
打死了第一关的boss，不得不说开头的剧情确实有点俗，目前的走向是我现在最不喜欢的轻小说，10年前的燃系gal路线（原来看多了有点反胃）。但是基于我对日厂的心理预期，游戏本身玩起来倒还中规中矩。剧情虽然俗，但是对前二刺螈的我来说也没什么不能接受的，就是感觉有点尬。

就是这个键盘默认键位啊，我在想到底是哪个天才设计的，空格键是进菜单，page up锁定，page down翻滚，而且这游戏是支持鼠标的，难道你们日厂觉得屁吸玩家都是触手吗？
系统自带的键位图是图片格式，让我回忆起育碧搞失落的星球移植了，所有键位图标都是对应的xbox手柄，屁吸键鼠玩家只能自己琢磨对应按键或者在实时战斗中根据下方的按键提示来熟悉操作，然而就是这个功能他们都没做好，我随便修改了下键位设置，然后要终结boss的时候，按键提示是按住xbox的X键和空格键，我的龟龟，X键是干啥的我哪里知道，然后我又去找前面的键位图，才发现是锁定敌人。然后我还原了默认键位设置打爆了boss，这才了解了设计者的良苦用心。page up down对应的是手柄的lb rb，在我的笔记本键盘上这两个键正好是左右并排的，设计者为了让键鼠的操作还原手柄真的是煞费苦心啊，真的天才。

顺便我想吐槽下这洋文翻译，女孩子家家的随口来一句语音里根本没有的crap来表示惊讶，真的好吗？
也想感谢一下各位汉化组成员的努力，辛苦了。

来个题外话:我对这几年的falcom一点也不了解，问下xanadu这个系列有没有通过这次的东京迷城还魂啊？期待下一次的xanadu画风能回到next的样子，音乐也是，剧情next有点喂屎还是大团圆算了。

《东京迷城eX+》，这游戏文本量有120多万字，图片资源是100多张，当然文本可以借用PSV官方中文的文本，但是这个借用的过程并不像大家想的这么简单。
大家都知道PC版只有英文文本，并没有日文文本和中文文本，PSV版只有日文文本和中文文本，并没有英文文本，所以你要把PSV的中文文本和PC的英文文本一一对上，只能自己人工去对应。

目前我们还在这个对文本的阶段，初步判断，至少有1/4的文本是PC版新增的，也就是需要我们补翻的。

38221422.review:
Wow the new trails of cold steel spinoff is pretty good
Wow I can't believe Persona 5 has finally come to PC
Wow I can't believe they localised Zwei 4

...It's very easy to joke about Tokyo Xanadu, it wears its influences on its sleeve. But it's also really good. It's got good writing, music, and the gameplay (once you're not talking to all the amazing npcs, which you should be doing) is pretty fun too, it's a nice balance of being simple to learn, tough to git gud. And they fixed the localisation mostly compared to the vita version! So now that's pretty good too, a few minor things aside. (Nothing immersion breaking, trust me. It's mostly in the tutorial graphic things? I assume they were more difficult to change for the localisation team.)

I'll probably come back and add an in-depth review once I've finished the game, but I'd recommend it to anyone who likes good writing, or any of the Ys games (as an example), or any of the games I joked about earlier. You don't need to play the previous games before this, they're largely unrelated. Not to say you shouldn't, Xanadu Next is pretty cool. But you don't have to at all.

The Description said it all.

Tokyo Xanadu eX+; a massive action RPG from the [u]masters of the genre[/u], Nihon Falcom! 

As 90% of the review's say. Its like:
- Persona
- Ys Series
- The legend of heroes: Trails of cold steel III

The game has Ys style battle gameplay, persona labarynth gameplay and similar story and the Arcus System as the legend of heroes series.

So if you like even one of these games listed you will love this game.

the additinal content in the Side storys are not boring in any way, as usual for nihon / falcom great job. ;)
my favorite side story is the first one due that you can play as [spoiler] White Shroud	[/spoiler] it was amazing.
the bosses in the side storys are pretty challenging to defeat which is great, 2nd side story is harder then last boss in game tbh and also unseen side story which wasnt in tokyo xanadu the original.

There are 8 Chapters, 8 side storys a intermission and after story to play with.
With each passing Chapter things get more dire in morimiya as increase of "eclipse gate's" showing up which means more work for the X.R.C. close friends are wound up in these events that means kou must use the power of the soul device to get through labyrinth after labyrinth saving friends and foe's alike. the 3 major underground organization's. zodiac, nemesis and the Kronos Orden knights (Holy Spirit Church) are helping in the destruction of the eclipse.

there are bonding events for the girls and the boys so you can 'kinda get with them' there is one at the climax and after story.

there are alot of easter eggs from trails of cold steel such as, demon prince rean and magical girl alisa.
there are small easter eggs of ys such as, Ys Vs The Legend of heroes poster.

they can easily make a 2nd one if they wanted too, especially since there were no organization that supported the eclipse and trying to bestow ruin in the world, besides one alone dude if you count him.

there are still some small problems.
- play for too long and the game freezes
- wanting to win lottery
- gambling for a plushy doll
- [strike] loot boxes	[/strike] :p jk
- wondering who is best girl then the last chapter comes and you realize she has been there the whole time. Shiori, [b] NOT ASUKA[/b]
- A bad dub to eng sub, did a mexican sub it in eng?

the pro's are everything. the music is from falcom sound team JDK so thats a obvious plus, the story is from nihon / falcom which is obvious plus and there as a 99% amazing port to PC and lovable characters AND MECHA'S, what cant you hate about this game?

Tokyo xanadu ex+ has about 76Hrs Of gameplay so its worth the time and money. $1=1Hr

to sum it all up try Tokyo Xanadu ex+ if you liked it consider Buying The legend of heroes series because too this day its one of Nihon / Falcom Main Mascot Franchises.

[h1]Порадовало система боя, которая не даст заскучать в битвах. И так, хочу выделить несколько плюсов:[/h1]
+ есть двойной прыжок([b]этого не хватает во многих подобных играх[/b])
+ уклонение, уклонение в прыжке(этого тоже, однозначно приятный бонус)
+ можно использовать магию, помимо обычного ближнего боя. Использовать магию в воздухе
+ настройка персонажа, прокачка lvl различных навыков(максимальный уровень - 3) 
+ немало интересных персонажей, особенно женский пол порадовал. В основном только за них и играю:)
+ можно мгновенно переключать одного персонажа на другого
+ нескучные противники, босс-баттлы
+ музыкальное сопровождение. Всё очень лампово. В зависимости от ситуации, она бывает: мелодичной, веселой, мотивирующей.
Также, в меню я нашел много бесплатного шмота, это ещё один большой плюс. Теперь у меня в игре есть кошко-девушка:з 

[h1]Минусы игры не столь критичны, но они есть:[/h1]
- извечная проблема тех, кто не знает английский(в том числе и моя) - нет русского языка. Однако, текста здесь довольно-таки много. Можно с каждым ноунеймом завести диалог, но толку, если понимаешь 2-3 слова и то, если повезёт.
- в настройках можно поменять только разрешение экрана монитора.
- изначально, управление в игре будет неудобным. То есть, тот же прыжок будет на кнопке Backspace, а меню - на пробеле. И всё же, есть возможность переназначить клавиши так, как тебе будет удобно.
- и, опять же, скучные и, в принципе, не нужные DLS. Те же бесплатные костюмы приятнее на вид, нежели чем те, что предлагает нам DLS.

Обычно, я могу подождать полгода, да даже год, лишь бы у игры, которую я хочу купить, была скидка хотя бы в 50%. Но здесь случай иной. Игра стоит своей полной цены. Скорее всего, буду перепроходить, и не раз. Я искренне рад, что она появилась в стиме, и что мой ПК тянет её. ٩(◕‿◕｡)۶

38170788.review:
这游戏我早就玩过原版了，ps4的版本我买了但没怎么玩，不过增加的内容我基本上是了解的。
这游戏无毒无害放心食用，不会出现，好基友是卧底，我是你爹，戴眼镜的都是二五仔，胖子都不能信等坑爹情况，也不会出现伙伴突然就挡枪死了的胃疼场面。这游戏里奇迹和魔法都是存在的， 只要你天天做好人好事就能逆天改命。
人物非常可爱，除了主角和伙伴以外也有很多有趣的NPC，EX+比原版多了很多需要收集的人物笔记，强迫症除了每推进一次剧情就扫一遍地图也没啥好办法了
这游戏的战斗部分只能说凑合玩，超低配黑暗之魂的感觉，敌人设计不走心，就那么几只木偶一样的东西还反复用，换个颜色就当新敌人用了，有些模型明显就是直接从闪轨copy过来的。迷宫就是随机生成迷宫的水准。高难度的难点主要是敌人攻击力高的吓人，原版还好，ex+高难度吃药有CD，有些招数比较难躲的boss会非常虐，新手千万别看了原版的攻略以为这游戏最高难度也很简单然后选最下面的难度。
这个游戏虽然顶着xanadu的名字但完全就是轨迹，和轨迹完全相同的剧情模式，和轨迹一模一样的支线委托，料理，羁绊，回路，人物笔记，这个游戏实际上是falcompsv时代集大成的作品，有人说这就是伊苏和轨迹合体，我反对这种看法，这游戏完全一点都不像伊苏，战斗部分实际是轨迹地图攻击的扩展，100%的轨迹浓度。
实际上这个游戏是比闪轨要强的，很多人就爱喷这个游戏的的剧情无新意，老套，轻小说厕纸，闪轨边角料，然后把这游戏贬的一文不值。但我必须得说这游戏实际上非常有水准，这游戏继承了轨迹系列所有的优点，剧情虽然老套但讲的还行，没有留下让人在意的悬念但也留了些给续作的线索。这游戏各种意义上非常像零之轨迹，都是在小地方展开，所以有更充分时间去刻画这个世界的人和物。除了主角以外各种路人也有自己的故事，随着剧情推进偶尔还会和主角发生交集。队友也不再围着主角转，而是会进行非常有趣的互动甚至有发展出特殊关系的倾向。
这游戏的剧情就是一个非常清新的故事，对一个编剧自己都吐槽自己都和的剧本吹毛求疵是不是搞错了什么， 这游戏做出来就是想让大家都乐一乐。各种套路和梗明显就是服务falcom的粉丝。
吐槽画面我只能说这本质上是个PSV游戏，成天拿画面说事简直招人嫌，falcom一个小作坊做这种大规模的rpg肯定要有所取舍，演出之类的只能说社长尽力了，你要和3A游戏全程动捕的过场比那叫自讨没趣，这游戏的演出能把故事讲清也就差不多了。
还有求中文的，别在这嚷嚷啦，这版本面向欧美发行，我们也就是蹭一下而已，有这闲工夫不如去3大妈，这游戏汉化有PSV打底还是有戏的，你去3大妈水比在这有用的多

38160630.review:
玩了14小时我决定第二次写评价。

首先你们不要上当！这不是回合制游戏，而是动作类游戏。
与同时期动作类游戏相比，逊色不少，我说的《尼尔 机械纪元》《巫师3》《刺客信条》《地狱之刃》这些。
优秀的作品都是自动帮助玩家调整视角，这个还得你鼠标调整视角。
Falcom公司用回合制RPG的思路还完成这个游戏，所以BOSS战斗思路很奇怪。
先D-drive破除防御，然后开大招输出，怎么看怎么像是《闪之轨迹》。
这不是动作类游戏追求的打击感，而是RPG回合制追求的大招流。

如果你想看剧情，劝你别买，这个剧情属于“无中生有”，为了打架而编故事，扯淡到不行。
属于当下流行的“地下城”类游戏，因此游戏名应该翻译为《东京地下城》。
男主角是典型的逼王，佐助那种，一堆女的去倒贴他，想买的自己悠着点。

然后我说说这款游戏的优点。

女主角还不错。第一眼一般，后续耐看，声优棒，打架还露底。
有很多轨迹系列元素，如宣传照，小游戏，饰品等。
不用太担心没有汉化，我英语4级没过照样能看，没多少生僻单词，不行就查字典。

还有一个最大的优点，现在有18禁撕衣补丁，你们可以看我截图库，有效果图。
一边打架，让敌人撕女主角的衣服，爽到爆。

38158768.review:
这是第一次接触东京迷城，趁热玩了四个小时，简单说说感受。

首先虽然比不上轻车熟路的XSEED，但Aksys的移植是合格的，目前来看除了人物运动速度太慢以外挑不出什么大毛病，键位设置也都比较合理，相比XSEED的闪1，画面、turbo mode、操作等等能调节的设置不太多。

前面一个小时剧情介绍了一下大灾难Tokyo Earthquake十年后 [strike] 平凡 [/strike] 男主的校园生活，设定是相当俗套的男主表姐+青梅竹马+转校女主+父母双忙，之后逛了一个多小时的校园+城市，跟NPC们对话[strike] 顺便找好看的妹子 [/strike] ，可以看出东轨里面NPC的模型做的是很用心的，萌妹子超多[strike] 神似加藤惠，银发短马尾，我都截图了 [/strike]！小哥们也很帅！甚至就算是没有名字的NPC外观也是不一样的（目前为止）。

除了之前的直接穿越过来的Towa会长，在商业街一路你会发现许多彩蛋，商业中心里star camera摊位，中间大屏幕里放着闪三黎恩的静止画像，旁屏幕播着闪轨2的pv；隔壁书店里的一排封面为打了码的迪塔前市长的名为富豪的哲学的书，一排封面印着铁血宰相奥斯本的书，三张挂画分别是克洛、罗伊德和艾莉、黎恩仨后宫，各种Falcom音乐CD，轨迹月刊，xanadu设定集（？）等等，看了就想笑哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈。

直到接近第四个小时，才正式开始战斗，打击感还可以，实际操纵起来有点蛋疼，东轨男主动作连贯性不如双星2男主，女主跟男主的打法基本上是一样的又不像双星2公主那样可以开无双，这就导致除了element（元素）克制需要切换男女主，其他情况下没有切换的必要，比较爽的是闪避，每次你成功闪避都会有一个短时间慢动作和”Cool!"的icon。

[spoiler] 女主跳起来的时候可以看到胖次，颜色什么的自己去玩吧就知道了哈哈哈哈哈 [/spoiler] 

明早起来继续玩。

希望伊苏8也有这个移植质量就可以了，然而跳票到明年了，emmmm，whatever
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

目前我就把东轨当作双星物语续作来玩好了= =
缩卵社长怕卖不出去就把游戏叫做那由多的轨迹来骗人玩的招数用过一次还tm用，东轨跟迷城的国度也没什么关系= =
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
目前闪退两次，还没有找到解决方法。

38155548.review:
For a first time player like me, this has been a really enjoyable experience. I never played the original release as I'm strictly a PC gamer, so I was able to come into this title with no expectations and a clear, level head.

---

The good stuff:

The story and cast of characters are engaging and really grabbed my attention. I didn't expect the story to go the way it did and every time I thought it was over, something else happened and it continued. Most of the characters had a decent amount of growth, except the main character. He basically stuck with his original personality throughout the entire game (not a complaint). 

Game performance was consistent and enjoyable throughout my entire playthrough of the game, the true ending and the eX+ content. I held an extremely smooth and consistent 60fps the entire time with my system. 4790k/290x/16gb

Now for the bad stuff:

Until you get accustomed to the controls, the combat can feel a bit clunky. Somewhere between a fast paced version of Cold Steel and a slower clunkier version of Ys. Once you get used to it, it becomes much more enjoyable.

The story had a few slower moments, but they were few and far between.

Not enough time spent with Rion. Just sayin'.

---

The Verdict:

With this being a remaster/port of a 2 year old game, I honestly cannot justify the $60 price tag. It's an excellent game, but it's several years old at this point and honestly it deserves something more like a $40 MSRP because of this. If you're interested in the genre and/or Falcom games in general, go buy it. It's totally worth it. 

Rion best girl.

38150513.review:
If you're not new to Falcom games, this is the game that merges Trails of Cold Steel's generic+tropey+cliche yet good and fun story with Ys fast-paced action RPG combat. 

If you're mew to Falcom games, they're a company whose niche is making mostly action jrpg's with predictable yet fun stories. And the games that are turn-based have such a huge emphasis in fleshing out their worlds that the only other comparison I can make is Witcher.

If you played the Vita version, prepare to be salty as this is the definite version of the game, and it brings:

1) Stable 60 FPS and higher resolution
2) New side stories (basically dungeons with a little plot to flesh out the character relationships)
3) After Story: A new chapter that takes place after the main story.
4) New playable characters at certain parts of the game.
5) Expanded friend pages
6) Battle changes - combat has been made a lot more difficult than the Vita version, like the addition of new EX Skills
7) New difficulty options - Calamity, higher than Nightmare, possibly rivaling Inferno mode from Ys games. Infinity mode is also an option for NG+ and can be paired with the existing difficulty settings. Wanna do Calamity + Infinity? :D
8) Kou can now decorate his room and this triggers more options.

Story-wise this is a tongue-in-cheek parody of Trails. Combat-wise this is in par with Ys VIII (which isn't out yet on Steam).

38149187.review:
Tokyo Xanadu eX+ is the updated and upgraded version of the previously released vita game, Tokyo Xanadu, boasting improved HD graphics, additional story content - presented in the form of both post-chapter side stories and post-game content - as well as improved framerates.

[h1][u]Story[/u][/h1]
As always with Falcom's games, one may or may not find the opening sequences to the game somewhat generic and lacking in many departments, Though that is - in my opinion - what makes their games so intriguing and special. Falcom has a way of taking generic settings, ideas, and sterotypes found in other mediums, and taking them that one step futher to create something genuinely stunning and unforgettable. 

Tokyo Xanadu has an interesting premise no doubt, however that's not to say that the story is comparable to that of Falcom's flagship Trails series. Though interesting enough, the story boils down to (for the most part) episodic sequences that contain slice-of-life moments, an introduction or reveal that leads to the climax, the climax, and finally a wrap up of the chapter (pretty similar to Cold Steel 1). Though great in its own right, just don't expect anything quite [i]that[/i] amazing.

[h1][u]Gameplay[/u][/h1]
Think Ys with slower paced combat. The Trails series, with near identical story and character progression. This game for the most part, follows the same three day story structure each chapter. [b]Day one[/b] is your slice-of-life wandering around areas doing quests and whatever. [b]Day two[/b] is the lead up or climax of the chapter, and [b]day three[/b] is the conclusion to the chapter. 

Tokyo Xanadu, like Ys, takes an action combat approach to the game, and oh boy does it get fun. Once you get past the tutorial dungeons, you'll be speeding through corridors, slaying enemies left and right, switching out party members, all the while in pursuit of the dungeon's boss.

[h1][u]Graphics & Presentation[/u][/h1]
I am blown away by the amount of detail Falcom have put into their world. From the bookstores and hardware stores in Station Street, to the Arcades and Florist in the entertainment district and Brick Alley respectively. If you have played through any of Falcom's previous titles you [i]will[/i] no doubt find amusing and downright in-your-face references left and right. This also includes bonding scenes! [spoiler]Towa has one where she makes Kou help with her shopping, only to make Kou carry an abundant amount of bags. This is followed by her stating that she claims to have done something similar before, like deja vu...(Cold Steel I reference)[/spoiler]

Graphic wise, there's not much to coment on. It's pretty good for a HD remaster and quite the bit better than Cold Steel I and II, while falling behind CSIII. It might not blow anyone's mind, but at least the expressions are there, and there are some pretty impressive character models.

[h1][u]The PC Port[/u][/h1]
This time around, Aksys teamed up with Ghostlight to create the port. I can safely say that this game runs like a dream on my i3 6100 GTX 1060 3GB at 1080p and yes, that is overkill. I have seen reports of this game running on 5 year old laptops with minimal frame drops @60fps. 

Translation wise, Aksys have taken it upon themselves to look over the script from the Vita version and for the most part, I have had absolutely no complaints about the translation quality. With the help of the beta testers, most if not all grammar and text errors should have been ironed out. I wouldn't say that it is to the standards we've all come to expect out of  XSEED, but nothing I have come across so far has taken away from my enjoyment.

[h1][u]The Not-So-Good[/u][/h1]
- The enemy targeting system can feel - at times - clunky, preventing you from locking onto your desired target.
- Dungeon design. Though each main dungeon has its own defining aesthetic, the designs are straightforward, with the occasional branching corridor. 
- The button combos to do certain actions can be a bit too sensitive(?). For example, when trying to air dash across gaps, you may end up charging up an aerial spin attack with Kou.
- The linear story progression may start to show its wear. Going back to square one and etc..

[h1]Final Score: 8.5/10
If you love Falcom or more dialogue heavy games with damn good OSTs and addicting gameplay, picking this game up is a no brainer. You'll love the hell out of it. [/h1]

38148126.review: Nihon Falcom снова выпустила одну из своих великолепных JRPG, по игровому процессу эта игра напоминает Trails of Cold Steel, только бои идут от третьего лица в реальном времени. Сюжет, социальная составляющая (снова здравствуй школа), рпг-элементы характерные для игр этой компании - все на месте. Ребята, играем и радуемся, ибо скоро они выпустят Cold Steel II (а может еще и третью и четвертую часть на ПК) и Ys VIII Lacrimosa of Dana (как только закончат приличный перевод на английском). Всем фанатам Nihon Falcom брать обязательно, так как эта компания всегда выпускает добротные JRPG.
